leftvalue.name: Levelled
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Levelled scores tend to believe in social mobility, easy access to workplaces, and at high values, in socialism.

rightvalue.name: Stratified
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Stratified scores tend to believe in economic hierarchies, traditional workplace structures, and at high values, caste systems.

leftvalue.name: Usage
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Usage scores tend to believe that land belongs to those who use it the most, that rent is unjustified, and at high values, in commons.

rightvalue.name: Rent
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Rent scores tend to believe that land belongs to the first to claim it, that rent is justified, and at high values, in manorialism.

leftvalue.name: Planning
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Planning scores tend to believe that individuals have innate requirements, that we should direct the economy away from luxuries, and at high values, in planning.

rightvalue.name: Markets
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Markets scores tend to believe that individuals each have separate wants, that we should allow free production of goods, and at high values, in laissez-faire.

leftvalue.name: Central
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Central scores tend to believe that the economy should be organized as one cohesive entity, that key industry should be state-owned, and at high values, in corporatism.

rightvalue.name: Local
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Local scores tend to believe that the economy should be constitued of small parts, that industry should be decentralized, and at high values, in anarchism.

leftvalue.name: Automated
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher Automated scores tend to believe in industrialism, replacing manual jobs for robotic ones, and at high values, in total automation.

rightvalue.name: Employed
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Employed scores tend to believe in luddism, keeping labor made by hand, and at high values, in agrarianism.

leftvalue.name: National
leftvalue.blurb: Those with higher National scores tend to believe in high tariffs on imports, subsidies on national industry, and at high values, in isolationist autarky.

rightvalue.name: Global
rightvalue.blurb: Those with higher Global scores tend to believe in low tarrifs on imports, allowing worldwide competition, and at high values, unrestricted global trade.

rawtext.title: EconValues
rawtext.whatare12v_text: There are 6 independent axes - Structure, Land, Production, Control, Work and Trade - and each has two opposing values assigned to them:

instructiontext.title: EconValues
instructiontext.instructiontext: You will be presented with 132 statements. For each one, click the button with your opinion on it.
